inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of cirrhosis: Based on liver biopsy or clinical assessment of a hepatologist
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Based on history, exam, laboratory and radiographic evidence

inclusion.criterion: History of at least one episode of overt HE, defined by West Haven Criteria Grades II to IV
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Episodes of HE that were precipitated by gastrointestinal hemorrhage requiring transfusion of at least 2 units of blood

inclusion.criterion: Compliant with lactulose and rifaximin treatment (lactulose: at least one dose at least 5 days per week; rifaximin: at least one dose at least 5 days per week)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has been taking lactulose and rifaximin as prescribed

exclusion.criterion: Current episode of overt HE as defined by West Haven Criteria Grades II to IV
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Expectation of liver transplantation within two months of the screening visit
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of cirrhosis and has been compliant with lactulose and rifaximin treatment. However, there is no indication of current overt HE or expectation of liver transplantation within two months.
